summary: The document serves as a formal notification about the establishment of a military cover backstop, as stipulated by the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It meticulously details the procedures, including the use of specific forms and adherence to certain regulations, for managing changes, transfers, and responsibilities related to military cover operations. Additionally, it provides instructions on distribution and mentions the applicability of temporary and continuing effective dates for block records.
key_findings: The document is related to the establishment and management of a military cover backstop under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.

It outlines specific forms (Form 642, Form 1322, Form 1323) and regulations (HB 20-800.2, HB 20.661-1, R 240-250) for changing limitation categories, issuing Army W-2, and transferring cover responsibility.
The document includes distribution instructions and mentions temporary and continuing effective dates for block records.
